definitions.definition: To put up by the fitting together of materials or parts.
examples: to erect a house or a fort

definitions.definition: To cause to stand up or out.
To raise and place in an upright or perpendicular position; to set upright; to raise.
examples: to erect a pole, a flagstaff, a monument, etc.

subdefinitions.definition: To spin up and align to vertical .
examples: As soon as electrical power was restored, the attitude indicators' gyros would have begun to erect .
subdefinitions.label_groups: intransitive , aviation , of a gyroscopic attitude indicator

definitions.definition: To lift up; to elevate; to exalt; to magnify.
To animate; to encourage; to cheer.
To cast or draw up (a figure of the heavens, horoscope etc.).
To enter a state of physiological erection.
To set up as an assertion or consequence from premises, etc.
To set up or establish; to found; to form; to institute.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To put up by the fitting together of materials or parts.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to stand up or out.
To raise and place in an upright or perpendicular position; to set upright; to raise.
( transitive ) To lift up; to elevate; to exalt; to magnify.
( transitive ) To animate; to encourage; to cheer.
( transitive , astrology ) To cast or draw up (a figure of the heavens, horoscope etc.).
( intransitive ) To enter a state of physiological erection.
( transitive ) To set up as an assertion or consequence from premises, etc.
( transitive ) To set up or establish; to found; to form; to institute.
